00021 using namespace std;
00022 
00023 /**
00024  * Convenience class for I/O operations on file descriptors.
00025  *
00026  * This class provides convenience methods for:
00027  *  - sending and receiving raw data over a file descriptor.
00028  *  - sending and receiving messages over a file descriptor.
00029  *  - file descriptor passing over a Unix socket.
00030  * All of these methods use exceptions for error reporting.
00031  *
00032  * There are two kinds of messages:
00033  *  - Array messages. These are just a list of strings, and the message
00034  *    itself has a specific length. The contained strings may not
00035  *    contain NUL characters (<tt>'\\0'</tt>).
00036  *  - Scalar messages. These are byte strings which may contain arbitrary
00037  *    binary data. Scalar messages also have a specific length.
00038  * The protocol is designed to be low overhead, easy to implement and
00039  * easy to parse.
00040  *
00041  * MessageChannel is to be wrapped around a file descriptor. For example:
00042  * @code
00043  *    int p[2];
00044  *    pipe(p);
00045  *    MessageChannel channel1(p[0]);
00046  *    MessageChannel channel2(p[1]);
00047  *    
00048  *    // Send an array message.
00049  *    channel2.write("hello", "world !!", NULL);
00050  *    list<string> args;
00051  *    channel1.read(args);    // args now contains { "hello", "world !!" }
00052  *
00053  *    // Send a scalar message.
00054  *    channel2.writeScalar("some long string which can contain arbitrary binary data");
00055  *    string str;
00056  *    channel1.readScalar(str);
00057  * @endcode
00058  *
00059  * The life time of a MessageChannel is independent from that of the
00060  * wrapped file descriptor. If a MessageChannel object is destroyed,
00061  * the file descriptor is not automatically closed. Call close()
00062  * if you want to close the file descriptor.
00063  *
00064  * @note I/O operations are not buffered.
00065  * @note Be careful with mixing the sending/receiving of array messages,
00066  *    scalar messages and file descriptors. If you send a collection of any
00067  *    of these in a specific order, then the receiving side must receive them
00068  *    in the exact some order. So suppose you first send a message, then a
00069  *    file descriptor, then a scalar, then the receiving side must first
00070  *    receive a message, then a file descriptor, then a scalar. If the
00071  *    receiving side does things in the wrong order then bad things will
00072  *    happen.
00073  * @note MessageChannel is thread-safe.
00074  *
00075  * @ingroup Support
00076  */
00077 class MessageChannel {
00078 private:
00079         const static char DELIMITER = '\0';
00080         int fd;
00081 
00082 public:
00083         /**
00084          * Construct a new MessageChannel with no underlying file descriptor.
00085          * Thus the resulting MessageChannel object will not be usable.
00086          * This constructor exists to allow one to declare an "empty"
00087          * MessageChannel variable which is to be initialized later.
00088          */
00089         MessageChannel() {
00090                 this->fd = -1;
00091         }
00092 
00093         /**
00094          * Construct a new MessageChannel with the given file descriptor.
00095          */
00096         MessageChannel(int fd) {
00097                 this->fd = fd;
00098         }
00099         
00100         /**
00101          * Close the underlying file descriptor. If this method is called multiple
00102          * times, the file descriptor will only be closed the first time.
00103          */
00104         void close() {
00105                 if (fd != -1) {
00106 			::close(fd);
00107                         fd = -1;
00108                 }
00109         }
00110 
00111         /**
00112          * Send an array message, which consists of the given elements, over the underlying
00113          * file descriptor.
00114          *
00115          * @param args The message elements.
00116          * @throws SystemException An error occured while writing the data to the file descriptor.
00117          * @pre None of the message elements may contain a NUL character (<tt>'\\0'</tt>).
00118          * @see read(), write(const char *, ...)
00119          */
00120         void write(const list<string> &args) {
00121                 list<string>::const_iterator it;
00122                 string data;
00123                 uint16_t dataSize = 0;
00124 
00125                 for (it = args.begin(); it != args.end(); it++) {
00126                         dataSize += it->size() + 1;
00127                 }
00128                 data.reserve(dataSize + sizeof(dataSize));
00129                 dataSize = htons(dataSize);
00130                 data.append((const char *) &dataSize, sizeof(dataSize));
00131                 for (it = args.begin(); it != args.end(); it++) {
00132                         data.append(*it);
00133                         data.append(1, DELIMITER);
00134                 }
00135                 
00136                 writeRaw(data);
00137         }
00138         
00139         /**
00140          * Send an array message, which consists of the given strings, over the underlying
00141          * file descriptor.
00142          *
00143          * @param name The first element of the message to send.
00144          * @param ... Other elements of the message. These *must* be strings, i.e. of type char*.
00145          *            It is also required to terminate this list with a NULL.
00146          * @throws SystemException An error occured while writing the data to the file descriptor.
00147          * @pre None of the message elements may contain a NUL character (<tt>'\\0'</tt>).
00148          * @see read(), write(const list<string> &)
00149          */
00150         void write(const char *name, ...) {
00151                 list<string> args;
00152                 args.push_back(name);
00153                 
00154                 va_list ap;
00155                 va_start(ap, name);
00156                 while (true) {
00157                         const char *arg = va_arg(ap, const char *);
00158                         if (arg == NULL) {
00159                                 break;
00160                         } else {
00161                                 args.push_back(arg);
00162                         }
00163                 }
00164                 va_end(ap);
00165                 write(args);
00166         }
00167         
00168         /**
00169          * Send a scalar message over the underlying file descriptor.
00170          *
00171          * @param str The scalar message's content.
00172          * @throws SystemException An error occured while writing the data to the file descriptor.
00173          * @see readScalar(), writeScalar(const char *, unsigned int)
00174          */
00175         void writeScalar(const string &str) {
00176                 writeScalar(str.c_str(), str.size());
00177         }
00178         
00179         /**
00180          * Send a scalar message over the underlying file descriptor.
00181          *
00182          * @param data The scalar message's content.
00183          * @param size The number of bytes in <tt>data</tt>.
00184          * @pre <tt>data != NULL</tt>
00185          * @throws SystemException An error occured while writing the data to the file descriptor.
00186          * @see readScalar(), writeScalar(const string &)
00187          */
00188         void writeScalar(const char *data, unsigned int size) {
00189                 uint32_t l = htonl(size);
00190                 writeRaw((const char *) &l, sizeof(uint32_t));
00191                 writeRaw(data, size);
00192         }
00193         
00194         /**
00195          * Send a block of data over the underlying file descriptor.
00196          * This method blocks until everything is sent.
00197          *
00198          * @param data The data to send.
00199          * @param size The number of bytes in <tt>data</tt>.
00200          * @pre <tt>data != NULL</tt>
00201          * @throws SystemException An error occured while writing the data to the file descriptor.
00202          * @see readRaw()
00203          */
00204         void writeRaw(const char *data, unsigned int size) {
00205                 ssize_t ret;
00206                 unsigned int written = 0;
00207                 do {
00208                         do {
00209                                 ret = ::write(fd, data + written, size - written);
00210                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00211                         if (ret == -1) {
00212                                 throw SystemException("write() failed", errno);
00213                         } else {
00214                                 written += ret;
00215                         }
00216                 } while (written < size);
00217         }
00218         
00219         /**
00220          * Send a block of data over the underlying file descriptor.
00221          * This method blocks until everything is sent.
00222          *
00223          * @param data The data to send.
00224          * @pre <tt>data != NULL</tt>
00225          * @throws SystemException An error occured while writing the data to the file descriptor.
00226          */
00227         void writeRaw(const string &data) {
00228                 writeRaw(data.c_str(), data.size());
00229         }
00230         
00231         /**
00232          * Pass a file descriptor. This only works if the underlying file
00233          * descriptor is a Unix socket.
00234          *
00235          * @param fileDescriptor The file descriptor to pass.
00236          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during file descriptor passing.
00237          * @pre <tt>fileDescriptor >= 0</tt>
00238          * @see readFileDescriptor()
00239          */
00240         void writeFileDescriptor(int fileDescriptor) {
00241                 struct msghdr msg;
00242                 struct iovec vec[1];
00243                 char buf[1];
00244                 struct {
00245                         struct cmsghdr hdr;
00246                         int fd;
00247                 } cmsg;
00248         
00249                 msg.msg_name = NULL;
00250                 msg.msg_namelen = 0;
00251         
00252                 /* Linux and Solaris doesn't work if msg_iov is NULL. */
00253                 buf[0] = '\0';
00254                 vec[0].iov_base = buf;
00255                 vec[0].iov_len = 1;
00256                 msg.msg_iov = vec;
00257                 msg.msg_iovlen = 1;
00258         
00259                 msg.msg_control = (caddr_t)&cmsg;
00260                 msg.msg_controllen = CMSG_SPACE(sizeof(int));
00261                 msg.msg_flags = 0;
00262                 cmsg.hdr.cmsg_len = CMSG_LEN(sizeof(int));
00263                 cmsg.hdr.cmsg_level = SOL_SOCKET;
00264                 cmsg.hdr.cmsg_type = SCM_RIGHTS;
00265                 cmsg.fd = fileDescriptor;
00266                 
00267                 if (sendmsg(fd, &msg, 0) == -1) {
00268                         throw SystemException("Cannot send file descriptor with sendmsg()", errno);
00269                 }
00270         }
00271         
00272         /**
00273          * Receive a message from the underlying file descriptor.
00274          *
00275          * @param args The message will be put in this variable.
00276          * @return Whether end-of-file has been reached. If so, then the contents
00277          *         of <tt>args</tt> will be undefined.
00278          * @throws SystemException If an error occured while receiving the message.
00279          * @see write()
00280          */
00281         bool read(vector<string> &args) {
00282                 uint16_t size;
00283                 int ret;
00284                 unsigned int alreadyRead = 0;
00285                 
00286                 do {
00287                         do {
00288                                 ret = ::read(fd, (char *) &size + alreadyRead, sizeof(size) - alreadyRead);
00289                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00290                         if (ret == -1) {
00291                                 throw SystemException("read() failed", errno);
00292                         } else if (ret == 0) {
00293                                 return false;
00294                         }
00295                         alreadyRead += ret;
00296                 } while (alreadyRead < sizeof(size));
00297                 size = ntohs(size);
00298                 
00299                 string buffer;
00300                 args.clear();
00301                 buffer.reserve(size);
00302                 while (buffer.size() < size) {
00303                         char tmp[1024 * 8];
00304                         do {
00305                                 ret = ::read(fd, tmp, min(size - buffer.size(), sizeof(tmp)));
00306                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00307                         if (ret == -1) {
00308                                 throw SystemException("read() failed", errno);
00309                         } else if (ret == 0) {
00310                                 return false;
00311                         }
00312                         buffer.append(tmp, ret);
00313                 }
00314                 
00315                 if (!buffer.empty()) {
00316                         string::size_type start = 0, pos;
00317                         const string &const_buffer(buffer);
00318                         while ((pos = const_buffer.find('\0', start)) != string::npos) {
00319                                 args.push_back(const_buffer.substr(start, pos - start));
00320                                 start = pos + 1;
00321                         }
00322                 }
00323                 return true;
00324         }
00325         
00326         /**
00327          * Read a scalar message from the underlying file descriptor.
00328          *
00329          * @param output The message will be put in here.
00330          * @returns Whether end-of-file was reached during reading.
00331          * @throws SystemException An error occured while writing the data to the file descriptor.
00332          * @see writeScalar()
00333          */
00334         bool readScalar(string &output) {
00335                 uint32_t size;
00336                 unsigned int remaining;
00337                 
00338                 if (!readRaw(&size, sizeof(uint32_t))) {
00339                         return false;
00340                 }
00341                 size = ntohl(size);
00342                 
00343                 output.clear();
00344                 output.reserve(size);
00345                 remaining = size;
00346                 while (remaining > 0) {
00347                         char buf[1024 * 32];
00348                         unsigned int blockSize = min(sizeof(buf), remaining);
00349                         
00350                         if (!readRaw(buf, blockSize)) {
00351                                 return false;
00352                         }
00353                         output.append(buf, blockSize);
00354                         remaining -= blockSize;
00355                 }
00356                 return true;
00357         }
00358         
00359         /**
00360          * Read exactly <tt>size</tt> bytes of data from the underlying file descriptor,
00361          * and put the result in <tt>buf</tt>. If end-of-file has been reached, or if
00362          * end-of-file was encountered before <tt>size</tt> bytes have been read, then
00363          * <tt>false</tt> will be returned. Otherwise (i.e. if the read was successful),
00364          * <tt>true</tt> will be returned.
00365          *
00366          * @param buf The buffer to place the read data in. This buffer must be at least
00367          *            <tt>size</tt> bytes long.
00368          * @param size The number of bytes to read.
00369          * @return Whether reading was successful or whether EOF was reached.
00370          * @pre buf != NULL
00371          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during reading.
00372          * @see writeRaw()
00373          */
00374         bool readRaw(void *buf, unsigned int size) {
00375                 ssize_t ret;
00376                 unsigned int alreadyRead = 0;
00377                 
00378                 while (alreadyRead < size) {
00379                         do {
00380                                 ret = ::read(fd, (char *) buf + alreadyRead, size - alreadyRead);
00381                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00382                         if (ret == -1) {
00383                                 throw SystemException("read() failed", errno);
00384                         } else if (ret == 0) {
00385                                 return false;
00386                         } else {
00387                                 alreadyRead += ret;
00388                         }
00389                 }
00390                 return true;
00391         }
00392         
00393         /**
00394          * Receive a file descriptor, which had been passed over the underlying
00395          * file descriptor.
00396          *
00397          * @return The passed file descriptor.
00398          * @throws SystemException If something went wrong during the
00399          *            receiving of a file descriptor. Perhaps the underlying
00400          *            file descriptor isn't a Unix socket.
00401          * @throws IOException Whatever was received doesn't seem to be a
00402          *            file descriptor.
00403          */
00404         int readFileDescriptor() {
00405                 struct msghdr msg;
00406                 struct iovec vec[2];
00407                 char buf[1];
00408                 struct {
00409                         struct cmsghdr hdr;
00410                         int fd;
00411                 } cmsg;
00412 
00413                 msg.msg_name = NULL;
00414                 msg.msg_namelen = 0;
00415         
00416                 vec[0].iov_base = buf;
00417                 vec[0].iov_len = sizeof(buf);
00418                 msg.msg_iov = vec;
00419                 msg.msg_iovlen = 1;
00420 
00421                 msg.msg_control = (caddr_t)&cmsg;
00422                 msg.msg_controllen = CMSG_SPACE(sizeof(int));
00423                 msg.msg_flags = 0;
00424                 cmsg.hdr.cmsg_len = CMSG_LEN(sizeof(int));
00425                 cmsg.hdr.cmsg_level = SOL_SOCKET;
00426                 cmsg.hdr.cmsg_type = SCM_RIGHTS;
00427                 cmsg.fd = -1;
00428 
00429                 if (recvmsg(fd, &msg, 0) == -1) {
00430                         throw SystemException("Cannot read file descriptor with recvmsg()", errno);
00431                 }
00432 
00433                 if (msg.msg_controllen != CMSG_SPACE(sizeof(int))
00434                  || cmsg.hdr.cmsg_len != CMSG_SPACE(0) + sizeof(int)
00435                  || cmsg.hdr.cmsg_level != SOL_SOCKET
00436                  || cmsg.hdr.cmsg_type != SCM_RIGHTS) {
00437                         throw IOException("No valid file descriptor received.");
00438                 }
00439                 return cmsg.fd;
00440         }
00441 };

00443 } // namespace Passenger
